newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Telstra Australia sees A$800 mln debt issues.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Telstra Australia sees A$800 mln debt issues.

text.p: The Australian government-owned telecommunications firm Telstra Corp Ltd expected to carry out debt raisings totalling A$800 million in the year to June 30, 1997, a company source said.
The source told Reuters the majority of the debt issued would be used to refinance existing debt.
"Telstra has a programme for 1996/97 of around about A$800 million fund raising in the capital markets and ... this won't be increasing its gross debt by a significant amount," the source said.
The majority of the debt issued during 1996/97 would be issued offshore, however Telstra swapped back all offshore debt to Australian dollars to avoid currency risk.

Currently, the most competitive rates for Telstra's debt could be found in euro medium term note (MTN) markets, but the use of this market would depend on the final form of interest withholding tax legislation, the source said.
The Japanese capital markets would be the next most favourable.
The company also was examining the U.S. market.
Telstra's current euro MTN programme is limited to A$1 billion, of which 40 percent has been drawn down.
The source said the AA rated programme could be quickly upgraded if necessary.
Debt to be refinanced under a 1996/97 programme would be of maturities of five to 10 years.
